result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan E Schroeder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: If defendant get his HSED or completes 100 hours of community service, the Court will consider that payment for the fine imposed.

records.addlTxt: Does not plan to seek postconviction relief

Defendant Ryan E Schroeder in court with attorney Mark D. Richards.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
The State files amended information. Defense acknowledges receipt, waives reading of same; NG plea entered. Deft will plead to all four charges, the State recommends w/held sent; probation w/90 days RCJ to be served. The State objects to expungement.
P-NC to Cts 1 & 3, G to Cts 2 & 4
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. Ct 1 - $1000.00 + cc, incl DNA
                                    Ct 2 - $1000.00 no costs or DNA costs. 12 mos to pay. If deft gets HSED or completes 100 hrs CSW, the Court will consider that payment for the fine imposed.
                                    Cts 3 & 4: $500.00 fine, no costs or DNA costs

       PPP - $200.00/mo on Cts 1, 3 & 4 to begin 09-15-2016. FTP: 1 day for every $50 owed

       If defendant pays all fines w/in 1 year, the matter may be expunged

Defendant Ryan E Schroeder in court with attorney Mark D. Richards.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Jennifer Tanck-Adams.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.

  Jury trial scheduled for August 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
ZCI
Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.
from Zimmerman Consulting Inc. - defendant is in compliance with agency requirements.
Pre-trial conference at 01-08-2016 08:15 am

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the co-defendants, NF, AK and AR.  Defendant may attend school but cannot attend class with any of the co-defendants.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
****MODIFIED 12/02/15 TO ALLOW CO-DEFENDANTS TO HAVE CONTACT AND TO HAVE CLASSES TOGETHER AT SCHOOL***
NG plea entered.
Reading waived.

Defendant Ryan E Schroeder in court with attorney Mark D. Richards.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Defense and State stipulate to bond condition modification. 
BTC: Bond modification is granted. Bond conditions are modified to allow co-defendants to have contact and also to have classes together at school. All other conditions remain.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:15 am.
